thread.title: Arsenal and Chelsea to battle PSG and Bayern Munich in summer race to sign Atletico Madrid winger Yannick Carrasco
thread.title_full: Arsenal and Chelsea to battle PSG and Bayern Munich in summer race to sign Atletico Madrid winger Yannick Carrasco

author: dwright
title: Arsenal and Chelsea to battle PSG and Bayern Munich in summer race to sign Atletico Madrid winger Yannick Carrasco
text:
EFL IN DEMAND Arsenal and Chelsea to battle PSG and Bayern Munich in summer race to sign Atletico Madrid winger Yannick Carrasco 
Atletico Madrid star on wanted list of big clubs across Europe as they plot squad overhauls By DUNCAN WRIGHT Comments ARSENAL and Chelsea have emerged as contenders in the race to sign Atletico Madrid star Yannick Carrasco. 
The 23-year-old Belgian has become one of the hottest properties in Europe this season with a host of big clubs tracking his signature. Getty Images 3 Yannick Carrasco is wanted by some of the biggest clubs in Europe this summer 
And news that Atletico may be prepared to case on on the winger has alerted some of the continent’s giants as they look to improve their squads in the summer. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Arsenal and Chelsea news , gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Arsenal and Chelsea lead the pack of clubs from the Premier League in the hunt for Carrasco’s signature. EPA 3 Arsenal and Chelsea face competition from Bayern Munich and PSG in the race to sign Yannick Carrasco 
But they will face stiff competition if they want to get their man with both Bayern Munich and Paris Saint Germain also tracking the wide man. 
Carrasco has become unsettled with the La Liga club this season after falling out with manager Diego Simeone. 
That has left both player and club in a position where they are open to a move, but it would take a bid of around £40million to tempt Atletico into selling. Getty Images 3 Belgian international Yannick Carrasco with Eden Hazard 
Such a figure would easily be within reach of Chelsea and PSG, while the funds are there at Arsenal if manager Arsene Wenger finally decides to spend big overhauling his squad. 
Bayern would be less able to put together such a large package, and would need to sell Douglas Costa before they made any move.
